title.value: Approximate minimization of weighted tree automata
title.justification: The title directly mentions the main focus of the paper which is the approximate minimization of weighted tree automata.
title.quote: Approximate minimization of weighted tree automata

extractions.description: This paper explores the approximate minimization problem for weighted tree automata, drawing inspiration from spectral methods used for weighted automata on strings. It introduces the concept of singular value tree automata, providing bounds on approximation quality and examining the complexities involved in computing this canonical form. The paper also connects iterative computation methods, like fixed point iteration and Newtonâ€™s method, to the problem, offering new insights.

type.justification: The paper focuses on theoretical concepts such as canonical forms, polynomial equations, and approximation bounds, without conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: This paper studies the following approximate minimization problem...

name.justification: The paper revolves around the theoretical study and minimization of weighted tree automata.
name.quote: This paper studies the following approximate minimization problem: given a minimal weighted tree automaton...

name.justification: The paper refers to spectral methods as an inspiration for the proposed automata minimization techniques.
name.quote: ...introduced a new canonical form for weighted automata called singular value automata inspired by spectral methods...
